com.engine.graphics

Class Screen

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.engine.graphics.Screen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CoreKeyListener, CoreObjectListener, EngineMouseListener, GuiComponentListener

    public abstract class Screen
extends java.lang.Object
implements GuiComponentListener, CoreObjectListener, CoreKeyListener, EngineMouseListener

    Screen

    A Screen is a particular level/menu of a project. A screen has methods to update logic and graphics based on the CoreClock. Screens are handled through the ScreenHandler class.

    Author:
    Ryan Hochmuth

      • Screen

        Create a new Screen.
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        public abstract void onCreate()
        Runs only once when the Screen is first created. onCreate() is used to set parameters before the onUpdate() method is called.

      • onUpdate

        public abstract void onUpdate()
        Runs every time a project update occurs from CoreClock. onUpdate() is used to update important object parameters during runtime.

      • unload

        public abstract void unload()
        What process should be done to unload this screen.

      • drawStaticBackground

        public abstract void drawStaticBackground(java.awt.Graphics g)
        drawStaticBackground() runs every time a project update occurs from CoreClock. This method should be used to draw static background images.
        Parameters:
        g -

      • drawBackground

        public abstract void drawBackground(java.awt.Graphics g)
        drawBackground() runs every time a project update occurs from CoreClock. This method should be used to draw graphics on the background layer
        Parameters:
        g -
        pixels -
        offset -
        row -

      • drawForeground

        public abstract void drawForeground(java.awt.Graphics g)
        drawForeground() runs every time a project update occurs from CoreClock. This method should be used to draw graphics on the foreground layer.
        Parameters:
        g -

      • drawGui

        public abstract void drawGui(java.awt.Graphics g)
        drawGui() runs every time a project update occurs from CoreClock. This method should be used to draw gui graphics on the up most layer.
        Parameters:
        g -
